answers.answer: Complex septated ovarian cyst may be really challenging for women who like to bear a child.Vaginal hysterectomy may preserve ovaries and not removed during surgical purposes.Problems caused due to cysts in ovaries can be managed by hormonal therapy and management of complications like Menstrual Disorders,infertility,Diabetes Milletus,Thyroid problems(Metabolic Syndrome) and masculinity which are seen in most of the patients suffering from cysts.As you are 54 years old it is advised to undergo a surgery called Ovary Drilling (puncture of large cysts) and change of diet and use of Hormonal therapy may actually help to control everything that you are suffering.Talk to your Doc about this.

question: I was recently diagnosed with a 4.8 cm complex septated ovarian cyst.  This was found incidentally on an abdominal CT.  I had a transvaginal US and the first results were a 3.3 cm complex septated cyst.  I have a followup US 8 weeks later and the 4.8 cm results were found.   I don't have a GYNE doctor.  My family doctor does my PAP and so forth.  I do  not know if I have gone through menopause yet because I had a hysterectomy 24 years ago and still had my ovaries.  My left ovary is not there any longer, but my right ovary is the one with the cyst.  I have been experiencing hot flashes for quite some time.  I have extreme abdominal bloating and right sided abdominal pain as well as a lot of low back pain.  Could you help me understand these results.
title: Worried about complex septated ovarian cyst
